avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released even by a single winter sport participant on north, east and south facing slopes above approximately 2000 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack here.
In areas close to the tree line a precarious avalanche situation will be encountered in some regions. Wind slabs are to be avoided. Defensive route selection is appropriate.

On very steep slopes individual small and medium-sized natural avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh and older wind slabs require caution. The avalanche prone locations are quite prevalent.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 70 cm of snow has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 2000 m.
The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. Since Wednesday on wind-loaded slopes small and medium-sized avalanches were released.
The old snowpack is hard. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below approximately 1800 m thus far only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Little snow will fall from the afternoon. The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The soft wind slabs of the last few days can be released even by a single winter sport participant on north, east and south facing slopes above approximately 2000 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep slopes and in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Weak layers exist in the top section of the snowpack here.
In areas close to the tree line a sometimes precarious avalanche situation will be encountered in some regions. In these regions the avalanche prone locations are more widespread. Meticulous route selection is appropriate.

In particular on very steep slopes individual mostly small natural avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh and older wind slabs require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 60 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 2000 m.
The upper section of the snowpack is unfavourably layered. Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on soft layers. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack. On Friday on very steep slopes several small and medium-sized avalanches occurred naturally.
The old snowpack is hard. Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. Below approximately 1800 m thus far only a little snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Little snow will fall from the afternoon. The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
Down to low altitudes snow fell on Friday.
In some localities mostly small wind slabs formed.
The new snow and wind slabs are lying on a crust in all aspects.
The wind slabs can be released in isolated cases at their margins. Especially transitions into gullies and bowls transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, in particular on very steep slopes.
There is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow significantly.

snowpackStructure.comment:
15 to 25 cm of snow has fallen since Wednesday above approximately 2000 m. The sometimes moderate wind has transported only a little snow.
Over a wide area new snow and wind slabs are lying on a hard crust.
Snow depths vary greatly at high altitude, depending on the infuence of the wind. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
Especially on steep sunny slopes only a little snow is lying. Also adjacent to ridgelines hardly any snow is lying.
In its middle, the snowpack is fairly homogeneous and its surface has a crust that is strong in many cases. This applies below approximately 2600 m.

tendency.comment: In some localities a little new snow: The avalanche danger will persist.
